head.title: Facade Piece Falls, Injuring Man Below

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Facade Piece Falls, Injuring Man Below

abstract.p: Thirty-pound chunk of cast-iron falls off facade of 1720 Broadway in Manhattan, seriously injuring pedestrian, Andrew Anowai (S)

block.p: A security guard who was returning home from work was injured yesterday morning when a 30-pound chunk of cast-iron facade fell off a building in Midtown Manhattan, a Fire Department official said.
Andrew Anowai, 41, of the Bronx, was struck about 7 a.m. by a piece of metal from 1720 Broadway, near 33rd Street, said Firefighter Robert Calise.

He was taken to Bellevue Medical Center, where he was expected to remain for several days for head, should and arm trauma, according to John Clark, a hospital administrator. He was in stable condition last night.

Several people have been struck by falling debris in recent weeks. On July 18, a tourist walking in Midtown suffered a fractured skull when a 25-pound stucco ornament loosened and fell 14 stories, knocking him unconscious. On July 19, a young woman was struck in the head by a brick that fell from a building undergoing renovation on the Lower East Side.
